title: Violent Incidents NO Identified Cartel - SLP
name: Violent Incidents NO Identified Cartel - SLP

properties.event summary: 09/25/2011: On Sunday night at 2230, in Rio Verde, San Luis Potosi, Mexico, two militants opened fire on officials who are posted at a nighttime check point at kilometer marker 30 on the Rio Verde-San Luis Potosi highway. Mexican Army personnel and Federal, State, and Municipal Police established the check point in response to civilian complaints. The militant individuals in a Chevy compact vehicle attacked the checkpoint with various firearms. The authorities returned fire, causing the gunmen to lose control of their vehicle, flip the car and crash. Both of the gunmen were killed in the accident, and during the shootout, one of the police authorities was wounded. After the accident police found and seized four rifles, a metal box containing 210 bullets of various calibers, 10 magazines for various weapons, a tactical vest, two tactical cartridge belts, and the Chevy vehicle. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
properties.event title: Militants Attack Military, Federal, and State Police in San Luis Potosi
properties.location: Two militants opened fire on officials who are posted at a nighttime check point at kilometer marker 30 on the Rio Verde-San Luis Potosi highway in Rio Verde, San Luis Potosi, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/18/2011: On Tuesday night, in Colonia Las Piedras, San Luis Potosi, San Luis Potosi, Mexico, four people were shot and wounded by three individuals. One suspect, 32-year-old Pedro Cesar Carrizales-Becerra, was caught by authorities on the corner of Granito y Travertino. Two of the other perpetrators escaped. Carrizales Becerra was identified as a perpetrator by one of the victims, who also identified the two other perpetrators. No group claimed responsibility.
properties.event title: Four People Shot in San Luis Potosi by Three Individuals
properties.location: The assault occurred in Colonia Las Piedras, San Luis Potosi, San Luis Potosi, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 11/02/2011: On Wednesday, in Catorce, San Luis Potosi, Mexico, the 12th Military Zone responded to a citizen report concerning the presence of armed people in the Real de Minas Hotel. When the military personnel arrived at the Hotel, the armed people opened fire at them. The military personnel returned fired and killed two criminals, injured one, arrested 10, and seized drugs, weapons and vehicles. No group claimed responsibility for this incident.
properties.event title: Military Personnel Repelled and Aggression Killing Two and Injuring One in Catorce, San Luis Potosi
properties.location: The incident occurred at a hotel in Catorce, San Luis Potosi, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 09/21/2011: On Wednesday, in San Luis Potosi, San Luis Potosi, Mexico, a state police operational director was shot and  killed. The individual was identified as 39 year old Gariel Castillo Ordaz (AKA EL Bolillo). The kidnappers tortured Catillo Ordaz and then murdered him with a shot to the head. No group claimed responsibility for this incident.
properties.event title: A State Police Operational Director was Killed in San Luis Potosi, San Luis Potosi
properties.location: The incident occurred in San Luis Potosi, San Luis Potosi, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 11/15/2011: On Tuesday night at 0110, in El Saucito, San Luis Potosi, Mexico, 15 year old Camilo Juarez Cantu, resident of Francisco Villa 148 in the Colonia Division del Norte, was shot and killed on the corner of J. Isabel Robles and Francisco Villa by a suspected member of the Los Police gang. The assailant started firing a pistol at a group of people talking on the corner. One of the bullets hit the victim in the chest which he then died from twenty minutes later at a hospital. No other casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility but the Los Police gang was suspected.
properties.event title: Boy Killed on Corner in El Saucito, Mexico
properties.location: The incident occurred on the corner of J. Isabel Robles and Francisco Villa in Colonia Division del Norte, El Saucito, San Luis Potosi, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 11/15/2011: On Tuesday afternoon at 1700, in El Saucito, San Luis Potosi, Mexico, unidentified gang members raided the church in front of the El Saucito cemetery during the funeral of a boy stabbed on Calle Margarita 144 in Colonia Pedroza on Sunday 11/13/2011. As the people began to exit the church two gang members opened fire upon the crowd. Municipal and State Police arrived and the gang members fled the scene. One person was injured in the attack. No group has claimed responsibility.
properties.event title: Shooting During Funeral Mass in El Saucito, Mexico
properties.location: The incident occurred at the church in front of the cemetery in El Saucito, San Luis Potosi, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/09/2011: On Sunday, in Mexico, militants bludgeoned and shot a man to death. The body was then dumped near Rancho La Liberatad, a white and yellow curtain was put on top of his body, and his head was covered with a black trash bag. The victim was believed to be 25-30 years old, and was wearing dark pants, white tennis shoes, and boxers with white and blue squares. No groups claimed responsibility.
properties.event title: Man Bludgeoned and Shot to Death in Mexico
properties.location: The man was killed in an unknown location in Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/19/2011 (Default Date): On Wednesday, in San Luis Potosi, Mexico, three men were killed and buried in a road in front of the Zona de Tolerancia (red light district) in Soledad de Graciano Sanchez. No group claimed responsibility.
properties.event title: Three Men Killed in San Luis Potosi, Mexico
properties.location: The assault occurred near the Zona de Tolerancia (red light district) in Soledad de Graciano Sanchez, San Luis Potosi, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/17/2011: On Monday, near San Luis Potosi, San Luis Potosi, Mexico, a man was shot and buried in a hidden grave. His body was recovered by the police on 10/24/2011 in an advanced state of decomposition. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
properties.event title: Man Shot in San Luis Potosi, Mexico
properties.location: The victim was killed near San Luis Potosi, San Luis Potosi, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 11/19/2011: On Saturday afternoon at 1600, at Copa de Oro bar located at the corner of Pedro Montoya and Moctezuma, San Luis, San Luis Potosi, Mexico, a man and a woman  and three others were injured in a bar shooting. The deceased were identified as Maria de la Luz Padron and Alberto Sanchez who worked as a waiter at the bar. It was unofficially revealed that strangers drinking at the bar had an altercation with the couple and ended up shooting the couple. When the Ministerial Police and Mexican Army arrived they found the two dead on the floor. No group or individual has claimed responsibility for this attack.
properties.event title: Two People Killed in Bar Shooting in San Luis Potosi, Mexico
properties.location: The armed assault occurred at Copa de Oro bar located at the corner of Pedro Montoya and Moctezuma in San Luis, San Luis Potosi, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 11/09/2011: On Wednesday, in San Luis Potosi, Mexico, four individuals were tortured and killed by unidentified assailants. The victims were three males and one female. They died by unknown means. A blanket was left at the scene with a message that was not released. No group claimed responsibility. No damages were reported.
properties.event title: Four Tortured and Killed in San Luis Potosi
properties.location: The assault occurred in an unknown location in San Luis Potosi, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 12/01/2011 (Default date): On Thursday a civilian was kindapped by unknown gunmen in La Huasteca, San Luis Potosi. The man was kidnapped at the beginning of the month and was rescued by the military after a military patrol was attacked by a gunman. The man was found inside of the trunk of a car on 12/21/2011. No further details were provided.
properties.event title: Individual Kidnapped in La Huasteca of San Luis Potosi
properties.location: The kidnapping took place at an unknown location in La Huasteca, San Luis Potosi, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 11/04/2011: On Friday, in Tamuin, San Luis Potosi, Mexico, military personnel were conducting patrols on a dirt road when an armed group attacked them.  The military personnel returned fired.  Red Cross paramedics arrived on the scene and reported that three people were killed during the confrontation. The report did not specify if the three individuals killed were from the Army or armed group.  No group claimed responsibility for this incident.
properties.event title: Military Personnel Attacked in Tamuin, San Luis Potosi
properties.location: The incident occurred on a dirt road in Tamuin, San Luis Potosi, Mexico.
